thread.title: Terry Rozier powers Celtics past Nets, 111-105
thread.title_full: Terry Rozier powers Celtics past Nets, 111-105

title: Terry Rozier powers Celtics past Nets, 111-105
persons: Jim Davis/The Boston Globe David Lee
text: Email AP | 10.20.15 | 7:43 AM Rookie Terry Rozier scored 16 points and had six assists to lead the Boston Celtics to a 111-105 preseason victory over the Brooklyn Nets on Monday night. Amir Johnson added 15 points and Kelly Olynyk 14 for Boston (4-1). Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Bojan Bogdanovic led the Nets (2-4) with 18 points. Thomas Robinson had 15 with nine rebounds. NETS: They had a reserve-filled starting lineup, sitting forwards Joe Johnson and Thaddeus Young, center Brook Lopez, and guards Wayne Ellington and Shane Larkin, all of them started against Boston last week. CELTICS: F/C David Lee (strep throat), G Isaiah Thomas (bruised leg) and F Jae Crowder (thumb) were out. TIMELY 3S: Celtics F James Young hit consecutive 3-pointers during an 8-0 fourth-quarter run. BIRTHDAY WISHES: Nets coach Lionel Hollins turned 62-years-old Monday. NICE STAT SHEET: Bostonâ€™s Evan Turner had 10 points, seven boards and six assists in 27 minutes. MONSTER SLAM: Celtics 6-foot-4 guard Marcus Smart had a second-quarter, putback dunk that brought the sparse crowd to its feet. UP NEXT: Brooklyn hosts Chicago on Wednesday. Boston is at home against the New York Knicks Thursday. Meet the 2015-16 Boston Celtics Isaiah Thomas, guard, four-year veteran, second season with Celtics: In 21 games with the Celtics in the 2014-15 season, Thomas averaged 19.0 points, 2.1 rebounds, and 5.4 assists in 26.0 minutes. Jason Miller/Getty Images Avery Bradley, guard, five-year veteran, sixth season with the Celtics: In 77 games with the Celtics in the 2014-15 season, Bradley averaged 13.9 points, 3.1 rebounds, and 1.8 assists in 31.5 minutes. Maddie Meyer/Getty Images Tyler Zeller, center, three-year veteran, second season with Celtics: In 82 games with the Celtics in the 2014-15 season, Zeller averaged 10.2 points, 5.7 rebounds, and 1.4 assists in 21.1 minutes. The Canadian Press, Chris Young/AP Jae Crowder, forward, three-year veteran, second season with Celtics: In 57 games with the Celtics in the 2014-15 season, Crowder averaged 9.5 points, 4.6 rebounds, and 1.4 assists in 24.2 minutes. Jim Davis/The Boston Globe David Lee, forward, 10-year veteran, first season with Celtics: In 49 games with the Warriors in the 2014-15 season, Lee averaged 7.9 points, 5.2 rebounds, and 1.7 assists in 18.4 minutes. Jim Davis/The Boston Globe
